layman:
PROCEDURE: Newborn circumcision.  
INDICATIONS: Parents chose to have the procedure.  
ANESTHESIA: Local block on the dorsal penile nerve.  

DESCRIPTION OF PROCEDURE: The baby was cleaned and covered with sterile cloth. A 1% lidocaine solution (4 mL, no epinephrine) was injected at the base of the penis at the 2 o’clock and 10 o’clock positions. The foreskin was removed with a Gomco clamp. Bleeding was minimal and stopped quickly. No signs of infection were seen. The baby tolerated the procedure well. Vaseline was applied to the penis, and the baby was dressed in a diaper by the nursing staff.
